lessons.title: Basic Greetings
lessons.description: Learning to say hello and hi

questions.title: Say Hello
questions.prompt: Hello children! When you meet someone, what is the first thing that you do? Let's learn to say hello!
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice saying hello together! Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.
questions.sample_answer: Hello! My name is [name]. Nice to meet you!

exercise_prompts.narration: Let's learn to say 'Hello'. Repeat after me: 'Hello'
Now let's wave our hand and say 'Hello'
Let's say 'Hello' with a big smile!
In the morning, we say 'Good morning'. Try saying 'Good morning'
In the afternoon, we say 'Good afternoon'. Try saying 'Good afternoon'

questions.title: Listening to Greetings
questions.prompt: Let's listen carefully to different ways people say hello. Can you hear the different greetings? We'll practice saying 'Hi' in different ways!
questions.teacher_script: We'll practice different ways to say hello. Listen carefully to each greeting and try to repeat it. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. Let's make our greetings sound warm and welcoming!

exercise_prompts.narration: Now let's learn another way to say hello. Say 'Hi'
Wave your hand and say 'Hi'
Let's practice saying 'Hi' to our friend

activities.title: Greeting Practice
activities.description: Students practice greetings while seated
activities.instructions: When I point to you, say 'Hello' or 'Hi' to the class

lessons.title: Goodbye Expressions
lessons.description: Learning different ways to say goodbye

questions.title: Say Goodbye
questions.prompt: Now we're going to learn how to say goodbye! It's just as important as saying hello. Are you ready to learn different ways to say goodbye?
questions.teacher_script: Let's learn different ways to say goodbye. We'll practice saying 'Goodbye' and 'Bye-bye'. Remember to wave your hand gently while saying goodbye - it's a friendly way to part!

exercise_prompts.narration: Let's learn to say 'Goodbye'. Repeat after me: 'Goodbye'
Wave your hand and say 'Goodbye'
We can also say 'Bye-bye'. Try saying 'Bye-bye'

activities.title: Goodbye Song
activities.description: Students sing a goodbye song while seated
activities.instructions: Let's sing together: 'Goodbye, goodbye, see you again!'

lessons.title: Time-based Greetings
lessons.description: Learning greetings for different times of day

questions.title: Morning Greetings
questions.prompt: Let's learn how to say good morning! When we meet in the morning, we say 'Good morning'. Can you say 'Good morning' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice saying good morning. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: When we meet in the morning, we say 'Good morning'. Repeat: 'Good morning'
Let's say 'Good morning, teacher'
When someone says good morning, we say 'Good morning to you too'
Let's say 'Have a good morning'

questions.title: Afternoon Greetings
questions.prompt: Let's learn how to say good afternoon! When we meet in the afternoon, we say 'Good afternoon'. Can you say 'Good afternoon' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice saying good afternoon. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: In the afternoon, we say 'Good afternoon'. Repeat: 'Good afternoon'
Let's say 'Good afternoon, everyone'
When someone says good afternoon, we say 'Good afternoon to you too'

questions.title: Evening Greetings
questions.prompt: Let's learn how to say good evening! When we meet in the evening, we say 'Good evening'. Can you say 'Good evening' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice saying good evening. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: In the evening, we say 'Good evening'. Repeat: 'Good evening'
Let's say 'Good evening, everyone'
When someone says good evening, we say 'Good evening to you too'

questions.title: Night Greetings
questions.prompt: Let's learn how to say good night! When we say goodbye at night, we say 'Good night'. Can you say 'Good night' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice saying good night. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Before going to bed, we say 'Good night'. Repeat: 'Good night'
Let's say 'Good night, sleep well'
When someone says good night, we say 'Good night to you too'

questions.title: Practice All Times
questions.prompt: Let's practice saying greetings for different times of day. Can you say 'Good morning', 'Good afternoon', 'Good evening', and 'Good night'?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice saying greetings for different times of day. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: The sun is rising. What do we say? 'Good morning'
It's lunch time. What do we say? 'Good afternoon'
The sun is setting. What do we say? 'Good evening'
It's bedtime. What do we say? 'Good night'

activities.title: Time Greeting Practice
activities.description: Students practice greetings based on time of day
activities.instructions: Look at the clock in each picture and say the correct greeting

lessons.title: Polite Greetings
lessons.description: Learning to say please and thank you with greetings

questions.title: Please and Hello
questions.content: Learn to say please with greetings
questions.prompt: Let's learn how to say please with greetings. When we want someone to do something, we say 'Please'. Can you say 'Please' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice saying please with greetings. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Let's learn the magic word 'please'. Say 'please'
Now let's say 'Hello, please come in'
Let's say 'Hello, please sit down'
Say 'Hello everyone, please listen'

questions.title: Thank You Greetings
questions.content: Learn to say thank you with greetings
questions.prompt: Let's learn how to say thank you with greetings. When someone helps us, we say 'Thank you'. Can you say 'Thank you' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice saying thank you with greetings. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Let's learn to say 'thank you'. Repeat: 'thank you'
Say 'Hello and thank you'
Let's say 'Goodbye and thank you'
Say 'Thank you, teacher, goodbye'

questions.title: Excuse Me
questions.prompt: Let's learn how to say excuse me with greetings. When we need to get someone's attention, we say 'Excuse me'. Can you say 'Excuse me' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice saying excuse me with greetings. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Let's learn to say 'excuse me'. Repeat: 'excuse me'
Say 'Excuse me, hello teacher'
Let's say 'Excuse me, I have to go. Goodbye'
exercise_prompts.saytext: Excuse me, I have to go. Goodbye

questions.title: Sorry Greetings
questions.prompt: Let's learn how to say sorry with greetings. When we make a mistake, we say 'Sorry'. Can you say 'Sorry' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice saying sorry with greetings. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Let's learn to say 'sorry'. Repeat: 'sorry'
Say 'Sorry I'm late, hello everyone'
Let's say 'Sorry, I have to say goodbye'
exercise_prompts.saytext: Sorry, I have to say goodbye

questions.title: Combining Polite Words
questions.prompt: Let's practice using multiple polite words. Can you say 'Please', 'Thank you', 'Excuse me', and 'Sorry'?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice using multiple polite words. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Say 'Hello, please sit. Thank you'
Say 'Sorry, excuse me, goodbye'
Say 'Hello, excuse me please. Thank you, goodbye'
exercise_prompts.saytext: Hello, excuse me please. Thank you, goodbye

activities.title: Polite Words Practice
activities.description: Students practice using polite words while seated
activities.instructions: When I show a picture, use the polite word that matches the situation

lessons.title: Greeting Songs
lessons.description: Learning greetings through simple songs

questions.title: Hello Song
questions.prompt: Let's learn the hello song. Can you sing 'Hello, hello, how are you?' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice the hello song. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Sing with me: 'Hello, hello, how are you?'
Now sing: 'I am fine, how about you?'
exercise_prompts.saytext: I am fine, how about you?

exercise_prompts.narration: Let's sing the whole song: 'Hello, hello, how are you? I am fine, how about you?'
exercise_prompts.saytext: Hello, hello, how are you? I am fine, how about you?

activities.title: Greeting Songs Practice
activities.description: Students sing greeting songs while seated
activities.instructions: Let's sing our greeting songs together

lessons.title: My Name
lessons.description: Learning to say your name

questions.title: Saying Your Name
questions.prompt: Let's learn how to say your name. When someone asks your name, you say 'My name is [your name]'. Can you say 'My name is [your name]' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice saying your name. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Let's learn to say 'My name'. Repeat: 'My name'
Now say 'My name is'
Say 'My name is [your name]'
Let's say 'Hello, my name is [your name]'

questions.title: I Am
questions.prompt: Let's learn how to say 'I am'. When someone asks your name, you say 'I am [your name]'. Can you say 'I am [your name]' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice saying 'I am'. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Let's learn to say 'I am'. Repeat: 'I am'
Now say 'I am [your name]'
Let's say 'Hello, I am [your name]'

questions.title: Nice to Meet You
questions.content: Learn to say 'Nice to meet you'
questions.prompt: Let's learn how to say 'Nice to meet you'. When someone says nice to meet you, you say 'Nice to meet you too'. Can you say 'Nice to meet you too' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice saying 'Nice to meet you'. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Let's say 'Nice to meet you'
Say 'Hello, I am [name]. Nice to meet you'
exercise_prompts.saytext: Hello, I am [name]. Nice to meet you

exercise_prompts.narration: When someone says nice to meet you, say 'Nice to meet you too'

questions.title: Introducing Age
questions.prompt: Let's learn how to say your age. When someone asks your age, you say 'I am [age] years old'. Can you say 'I am [age] years old' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice saying your age. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Let's say 'I am [your age]'
Now say 'I am [age] years old'
Say 'My name is [name] and I am [age] years old'
exercise_prompts.saytext: My name is [name] and I am [age] years old

questions.title: Complete Introduction
questions.prompt: Let's practice the full introduction. Can you say 'Hello, my name is [name]. I am [age] years old. Nice to meet you!' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice the full introduction. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Say 'Hello, my name is [name]'
Now say 'I am [name] and I am [age] years old'
exercise_prompts.saytext: I am [name] and I am [age] years old

exercise_prompts.narration: Let's put it all together: 'Hello, my name is [name]. I am [age] years old. Nice to meet you!'
exercise_prompts.saytext: Hello, my name is [name]. I am [age] years old. Nice to meet you!

activities.title: Introduction Practice
activities.description: Students practice introducing themselves
activities.instructions: When it's your turn, introduce yourself to the class

lessons.title: Asking Questions
lessons.description: Learning to ask and answer basic questions

questions.title: What's Your Name
questions.prompt: Let's learn how to ask someone's name. When someone asks your name, you say 'What is your name?' Can you say 'What is your name?' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice asking someone's name. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Let's learn to ask 'What is your name?'
We can also say 'What's your name?'
When someone asks your name, say 'My name is [your name]'
Let's practice both: 'What's your name?' 'My name is [your name]'
exercise_prompts.saytext: What's your name? My name is [your name]

questions.title: How Are You
questions.content: Learn to ask how someone is
questions.prompt: Let's learn how to ask how someone is. When someone asks how you are, you say 'How are you?' Can you say 'How are you?' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice asking how someone is. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Let's learn to ask 'How are you?'
When someone asks how you are, say 'I am fine'
Let's say 'I am fine, thank you'
Now say 'I am fine, thank you. And you?'
exercise_prompts.saytext: I am fine, thank you. And you?

exercise_prompts.narration: Let's practice the full exchange: 'How are you?' 'I am fine, thank you. And you?'
exercise_prompts.saytext: How are you? I am fine, thank you. And you?

questions.title: How Old Are You
questions.prompt: Let's learn how to ask someone's age. When someone asks your age, you say 'How old are you?' Can you say 'How old are you?' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice asking someone's age. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Let's learn to ask 'How old are you?'
When someone asks your age, say 'I am [age] years old'
You can also just say 'I am [age]'
Let's practice both: 'How old are you?' 'I am [age] years old'
exercise_prompts.saytext: How old are you? I am [age] years old

questions.title: Where Are You From
questions.content: Learn to ask where someone is from
questions.prompt: Let's learn how to ask where someone is from. When someone asks where you are from, you say 'Where are you from?' Can you say 'Where are you from?' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice asking where someone is from. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Let's learn to ask 'Where are you from?'
Say 'I am from [your country]'
Let's practice: 'Where are you from?' 'I am from [your country]'
exercise_prompts.saytext: Where are you from? I am from [your country]

questions.title: Complete Conversation
questions.prompt: Let's practice the full conversation. Can you say 'Hello! What's your name? How are you? How old are you?' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice the full conversation. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Let's start with: 'Hello! What's your name?'
Then ask: 'How are you?'
Let's put it all together: 'Hello! What's your name? How are you? How old are you?'
exercise_prompts.saytext: Hello! What's your name? How are you? How old are you?

activities.title: Question Practice
activities.description: Students practice asking and answering questions with a partner
activities.instructions: Take turns asking and answering questions with your partner

lessons.title: Feelings and Emotions
lessons.description: Learning to express how you feel

questions.title: Basic Feelings
questions.prompt: Let's learn how to express basic feelings. When you feel happy, sad, or excited, you can say 'I am happy', 'I am sad', or 'I am excited'. Can you say 'I am happy', 'I am sad', or 'I am excited' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice expressing basic feelings. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Let's say 'I am happy' with a big smile!
Now let's say 'I am sad'
Say 'I am excited' with enthusiasm!
Let's say 'I am tired'

questions.title: Feeling Questions
questions.prompt: Let's learn how to ask about feelings. When someone asks how you feel, you say 'How do you feel?' Can you say 'How do you feel?' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice asking about feelings. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Let's ask 'How do you feel?'
Ask 'Are you happy?'
Now ask 'Are you sad?'
Practice: 'How do you feel?' 'I feel happy!'
exercise_prompts.saytext: How do you feel? I feel happy!

questions.title: Today I Feel
questions.prompt: Let's learn how to express current feelings. When you feel happy, sad, or excited, you can say 'Today I feel [emotion]'. Can you say 'Today I feel [emotion]' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice expressing current feelings. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Say 'Today I feel [emotion]'
Say 'I feel happy because I am at school'
exercise_prompts.saytext: I feel happy because I am at school

exercise_prompts.narration: Say 'Today I feel happy because I am with my friends'
exercise_prompts.saytext: Today I feel happy because I am with my friends

questions.title: More Emotions
questions.prompt: Let's learn how to express additional emotions. When you feel hungry, thirsty, sleepy, or cold/hot, you can say 'I am hungry', 'I am thirsty', 'I am sleepy', or 'I am cold/hot'. Can you say 'I am hungry', 'I am thirsty', 'I am sleepy', or 'I am cold/hot' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice expressing additional emotions. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Let's say 'I am hungry'
Now say 'I am thirsty'
Say 'I am sleepy'
Let's say 'I am cold' or 'I am hot'

questions.title: Combining Feelings
questions.prompt: Let's learn how to express multiple feelings. When you feel happy, sad, or excited, you can say 'I am happy and excited', 'I am tired but happy', or 'I am happy to be here but I am tired'. Can you say 'I am happy and excited', 'I am tired but happy', or 'I am happy to be here but I am tired' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice expressing multiple feelings. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Say 'I am happy and excited'
Say 'I am tired but happy'
Say 'I am happy to be here but I am tired'
exercise_prompts.saytext: I am happy to be here but I am tired

activities.title: Emotion Expression
activities.description: Students practice expressing different emotions
activities.instructions: Show the emotion on your face and say how you feel

lessons.title: Complete Conversations
lessons.description: Learning to have full conversations using complete sentences

questions.title: Full Introduction Sentences
questions.prompt: Let's practice complete introduction sentences. Can you say 'Good morning, my name is [name]' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice complete introduction sentences. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Let's say a complete greeting: 'Good morning, my name is [name]'
Now say: 'Hello everyone, I am [name] and I am [age] years old'
exercise_prompts.saytext: Hello everyone, I am [name] and I am [age] years old

exercise_prompts.narration: Try this longer sentence: 'My name is [name], I am [age] years old, and I am happy to be here'
exercise_prompts.saytext: My name is [name], I am [age] years old, and I am happy to be here

questions.title: Two-Way Conversations
questions.prompt: Let's practice having complete conversations. Can you say 'Hello, how are you today?' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice having complete conversations. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Let's practice a conversation. When someone says 'Hello, how are you today?', respond with 'Hello, I am fine thank you, and how are you today?'
exercise_prompts.saytext: Hello, I am fine thank you, and how are you today?

exercise_prompts.narration: When asked 'What is your name?', respond with 'My name is [name]. What is your name?'
exercise_prompts.saytext: My name is [name]. What is your name?

exercise_prompts.narration: Practice this exchange: 'Hello, what is your name?' 'Hello, my name is [name]. It is nice to meet you. What is your name?'
exercise_prompts.saytext: Hello, my name is [name]. It is nice to meet you. What is your name?

questions.title: Tell About Yourself
questions.content: Practice telling a short story about yourself
questions.prompt: Let's practice telling a short story about yourself. Can you say 'Hello, I want to tell you about myself. My name is [name] and I am [age] years old' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice telling a short story about yourself. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Tell us about yourself: 'Hello, I want to tell you about myself. My name is [name] and I am [age] years old'
exercise_prompts.saytext: Hello, I want to tell you about myself. My name is [name] and I am [age] years old

exercise_prompts.narration: Now add: 'I live with my family and I have a [brother/sister]'
exercise_prompts.saytext: I live with my family and I have a [brother/sister]

exercise_prompts.narration: Tell us: 'I like to [activity] and my favorite color is [color]'
exercise_prompts.saytext: I like to [activity] and my favorite color is [color]

questions.title: Answering Questions Fully
questions.content: Practice giving complete answers to questions
questions.prompt: Let's practice giving complete answers to questions. Can you say 'I am [age] years old and my birthday is in [month]' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice giving complete answers to questions. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: When asked 'How old are you?', say 'I am [age] years old and my birthday is in [month]'
exercise_prompts.saytext: I am [age] years old and my birthday is in [month]

exercise_prompts.narration: When asked 'How are you?', say 'I am feeling very happy today because I am at school with my friends'
exercise_prompts.saytext: I am feeling very happy today because I am at school with my friends

exercise_prompts.narration: When asked 'What do you like?', say 'I like to play with my friends and I enjoy drawing pictures'
exercise_prompts.saytext: I like to play with my friends and I enjoy drawing pictures

questions.title: Meeting New Friends
questions.prompt: Let's practice conversations with new friends. Can you say 'Hello, my name is [name]. I am new to this class. Would you like to be my friend?' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice conversations with new friends. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Let's practice meeting someone new: 'Hello, my name is [name]. I am new to this class. Would you like to be my friend?'
exercise_prompts.saytext: Hello, my name is [name]. I am new to this class. Would you like to be my friend?

exercise_prompts.narration: Tell your new friend: 'I like to play [game] and draw pictures. What do you like to do?'
exercise_prompts.saytext: I like to play [game] and draw pictures. What do you like to do?

exercise_prompts.narration: Suggest an activity: 'Would you like to color pictures with me during playtime?'
exercise_prompts.saytext: Would you like to color pictures with me during playtime?

activities.title: Conversation Circle
activities.description: Students practice having complete conversations in a circle
activities.instructions: Take turns introducing yourself and asking questions to the person next to you

lessons.title: Daily Conversations
lessons.description: Learning to have conversations about daily activities

questions.title: Morning Conversations
questions.prompt: Let's practice morning conversation scenarios. Can you say 'Good morning teacher, I am ready for school today' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice morning conversation scenarios. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: When you arrive at school, say: 'Good morning teacher, I am ready for school today'
exercise_prompts.saytext: Good morning teacher, I am ready for school today

exercise_prompts.narration: Tell us about your morning: 'I had breakfast at home and I am feeling happy to see my friends'
exercise_prompts.saytext: I had breakfast at home and I am feeling happy to see my friends

exercise_prompts.narration: Share what you did: 'This morning I woke up early and I brushed my teeth before coming to school'
exercise_prompts.saytext: This morning I woke up early and I brushed my teeth before coming to school

questions.title: Talking About Activities
questions.content: Describe what you like to do
questions.prompt: Let's practice talking about activities. Can you say 'I like to draw pictures and my favorite color to use is [color]' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice talking about activities. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Tell us: 'I like to draw pictures and my favorite color to use is [color]'
exercise_prompts.saytext: I like to draw pictures and my favorite color to use is [color]

exercise_prompts.narration: Say: 'During playtime, I enjoy playing with blocks and sharing them with my friends'
exercise_prompts.saytext: During playtime, I enjoy playing with blocks and sharing them with my friends

exercise_prompts.narration: Tell us: 'In class, I like to learn new songs and I enjoy singing with my classmates'
exercise_prompts.saytext: In class, I like to learn new songs and I enjoy singing with my classmates

questions.title: Asking for Help
questions.content: Learn to ask for help politely
questions.prompt: Let's practice asking for help politely. Can you say 'Excuse me teacher, could you please help me with my drawing?' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice asking for help politely. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Practice saying: 'Excuse me teacher, could you please help me with my drawing?'
exercise_prompts.saytext: Excuse me teacher, could you please help me with my drawing?

exercise_prompts.narration: Say: 'Please may I have a pencil? I need it to write my name'
exercise_prompts.saytext: Please may I have a pencil? I need it to write my name

exercise_prompts.narration: After getting help, say: 'Thank you for helping me. Now I can finish my work'
exercise_prompts.saytext: Thank you for helping me. Now I can finish my work

questions.title: Sharing with Friends
questions.prompt: Let's practice sharing experiences. Can you say 'On Saturday, I went to the park with my family and I played on the swings' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice sharing experiences. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: Share about your weekend: 'On Saturday, I went to the park with my family and I played on the swings'
exercise_prompts.saytext: On Saturday, I went to the park with my family and I played on the swings

exercise_prompts.narration: Tell us: 'Yesterday evening, I helped my mother in the kitchen and we made dinner together'
exercise_prompts.saytext: Yesterday evening, I helped my mother in the kitchen and we made dinner together

exercise_prompts.narration: Share your plans: 'Tomorrow I will bring my favorite book to school and I would like to share it with my friends'
exercise_prompts.saytext: Tomorrow I will bring my favorite book to school and I would like to share it with my friends

questions.title: Solving Simple Problems
questions.content: Learn to express problems and solutions
questions.prompt: Let's practice solving simple problems. Can you say 'I cannot find my water bottle. Please can you help me look for it?' to me?
questions.teacher_script: Let's practice solving simple problems. Remember to speak clearly and with a friendly voice. We'll start with simple greetings and then make them more interesting.

exercise_prompts.narration: If you lose something, say: 'I cannot find my water bottle. Please can you help me look for it?'
exercise_prompts.saytext: I cannot find my water bottle. Please can you help me look for it?

topics.title: Numbers and Counting
topics.description: Learning to count and use numbers

subtopics.title: Counting to Five
subtopics.description: Learning to count from one to five

lessons.title: Numbers 1 and 2
lessons.description: Learning numbers one and two

questions.title: Number One
questions.prompt: Let's start learning numbers! Can you hold up one finger? This is the number one!
questions.teacher_script: Demonstrate holding up one finger. Make it engaging by relating to single objects in the classroom.
questions.sample_answer: One! I can show one finger!

exercise_prompts.narration: Show one finger
Point to one toy and say: 'I see one toy'
Count: 'One pencil'

questions.title: Number Two
questions.prompt: Let's learn a new number! After one comes two. Can you show me two fingers? Let's count together!
questions.teacher_script: We'll learn the number two. Hold up two fingers as we count. Remember to count clearly: 'one, two'. Look around the room - can you see two of anything?
questions.sample_answer: One, two! I can count to two!

exercise_prompts.narration: Say: 'Two'
Point and say: 'I see two books'
Count: 'One, two'

questions.title: Counting Objects
questions.prompt: Let's count some toys! How many toys do you see?
questions.teacher_script: Place one or two toys in front of the class. Guide students in counting them together.
questions.sample_answer: I see two toys! One toy, two toys!

exercise_prompts.narration: Count: 'I have one toy'
Count: 'I have two toys'
Count toys: 'One toy, two toys'

questions.title: Counting Body Parts
questions.prompt: Let's count parts of our body! How many noses do you have? How many eyes?
questions.teacher_script: Help students identify and count body parts. Emphasize the difference between one (nose) and two (eyes, ears, hands).
questions.sample_answer: I have one nose and two eyes!

exercise_prompts.narration: Point and say: 'I have one nose'
Point and say: 'I have two eyes'
Show and say: 'I have two hands'

questions.title: Counting in Class
questions.prompt: Look around our classroom! Can you find one thing? Can you find two things?
questions.sample_answer: I see one chair! I see two books!

exercise_prompts.narration: Point and say: 'One chair'
Show and say: 'Two pencils'
Count: 'One book, two books'

questions.title: Counting Actions
questions.prompt: Let's count while we move! Can you clap once? Can you jump twice?
questions.teacher_script: Demonstrate each action while counting. Ensure students are counting along with their actions.
questions.sample_answer: One clap! One, two jumps!

exercise_prompts.narration: Clap and say: 'One clap'
Jump and say: 'Two jumps'
Step and count: 'One step, two steps'

questions.title: Counting Friends
questions.prompt: Let's count our friends! Can you count one friend? Can you count two friends?
questions.teacher_script: Help students count their classmates safely and respectfully. Make it fun by having them form small groups.
questions.sample_answer: One friend, two friends!

exercise_prompts.narration: Point and say: 'One friend'
Point and say: 'Two friends'
Count: 'One friend, two friends'

questions.title: Counting Sounds
questions.prompt: Listen carefully! I'm going to make some sounds. Can you count how many sounds you hear?
questions.teacher_script: Make clear, distinct sounds (claps, taps, etc.) and pause between them. Help students focus on listening and counting.
questions.sample_answer: I heard two sounds! One sound, two sounds!

exercise_prompts.narration: Listen and say: 'I hear one sound'
Listen and say: 'I hear two sounds'
Count: 'One sound, two sounds'

questions.title: Counting Colors
questions.prompt: Let's count things by their colors! Can you find one red thing? Two blue things?
questions.sample_answer: One red ball! Two blue crayons!

exercise_prompts.narration: Point and say: 'One red ball'
Point and say: 'Two blue crayons'
Count: 'One yellow, two yellow'

questions.title: Counting Review
questions.prompt: Let's show everything we learned about counting! Can you count to two in different ways?
questions.teacher_script: Review all counting activities: fingers, objects, sounds, and actions. Celebrate students' counting achievements.
questions.sample_answer: I can count to two! One, two!

exercise_prompts.narration: Count and show: 'One finger, two fingers'
Count: 'One star, two stars'
Count together: 'One, two'

activities.title: Counting Fun
activities.description: Practice counting one and two with friends
activities.instructions: Count objects together with your friends

questions.teacher_script: Let's count colored objects. Can you show me three red crayons? Let's count together!

questions.teacher_script: Let's count animal pictures. Can you show me three cats? Let's count together!

subtopics.title: Counting to Ten
subtopics.description: Learning to count from six to ten

lessons.title: Numbers 6 and 7
lessons.description: Learning numbers six and seven

questions.title: Number Six
questions.prompt: Today we're going to learn a new number! Can you show me six fingers? We'll need both hands for this one!
questions.teacher_script: Demonstrate counting to six using fingers. Show how to use five fingers on one hand and one on the other to make six.
questions.sample_answer: One, two, three, four, five, six!

exercise_prompts.narration: Show six fingers
exercise_prompts.saytext: One, two, three, four, five, six!

exercise_prompts.narration: Point and say: 'I see six toys'
Count: 'One, two, three, four, five, six'
exercise_prompts.saytext: One, two, three, four, five, six

questions.title: Number Seven
questions.prompt: Now let's learn about the number seven! Can you show seven fingers? We'll need both hands for this one!
questions.teacher_script: Show how seven is made up of five fingers on one hand and two on the other. Help students visualize the quantity.
questions.sample_answer: One, two, three, four, five, six, seven!

exercise_prompts.narration: Show seven fingers
exercise_prompts.saytext: One, two, three, four, five, six, seven!

exercise_prompts.narration: Point and say: 'I see seven books'
Count: 'One, two, three, four, five, six, seven'
exercise_prompts.saytext: One, two, three, four, five, six, seven

questions.title: Counting Objects
questions.prompt: Let's count some toys together! We'll practice counting up to six and seven toys!
questions.teacher_script: Arrange toys in groups of six and seven. Guide students in touching each toy as they count.
questions.sample_answer: I can count six toys! One, two, three, four, five, six!

exercise_prompts.narration: Count: 'I have six toys'
Count: 'I have seven toys'
Count toys: 'Six toys, seven toys'

questions.title: Counting Body Parts
questions.prompt: Let's count parts of our body! How many fingers do you have on one hand? How about both hands?
questions.teacher_script: Help students count fingers on each hand, then combine them to understand six and seven.
questions.sample_answer: I have five fingers on one hand and two on the other hand!

exercise_prompts.narration: Show and count: 'Five fingers', How many fingers on one hand?
Show and count: 'Two fingers', how many fingers on one hand?
Count: 'Five fingers, two fingers'
exercise_prompts.saytext: Five fingers, two fingers in total seven fingers on both the hands

questions.title: Counting in Class
questions.prompt: Let's count items in classroom. Can you show me six chairs? Let's count together!
questions.teacher_script: Let's count items in classroom. Can you show me six chairs? Let's count together!

exercise_prompts.narration: Point and say: 'Six chairs'

Count: 'Six books, seven books'

lessons.title: Circle

questions.title: Say Circle
questions.prompt: Look at this round shape! Can you guess what shape this is? Let's learn about circles together!
questions.teacher_script: Show a circle shape or draw one on the board. Point to the continuous round edge to help students understand the circle's shape.
questions.sample_answer: This is a circle. It is round.

questions.title: Find Circles
questions.prompt: Now that we know what a circle looks like, let's be circle detectives! Can you find circles around our classroom?
questions.teacher_script: Walk around the classroom with students, helping them identify circular objects. Point to clocks, wheels on toys, or other circular items.
questions.sample_answer: I see a circle! The clock is a circle!
